revised_title: Analysis of the Inflammable Properties of Ochra Friabilis Nigro Fusca
tldr: This article discusses the experiments conducted on the Ochra Friabilis Nigro Fusca, a curious and useful earth discovered in 1752. The author, Josiah Wedgwood, investigates its properties, including its inflammable nature when mixed with linseed oil, and its potential use in painting. The article also explores the composition of the earth, including its manganese and lead content, and its behavior when exposed to heat.
